revised_title: The Action of Intermittent Radiant Heat on Gaseous Matter and Soap Bubbles
tldr: The author conducted experiments using an intermittent beam of radiant heat to study how different gases and vapors absorb heat. They discovered that the intensity of the sound produced by the gases and vapors was directly related to their absorption of radiant heat. The author also found that soap bubbles were suitable for sound lenses due to their flexibility and sensitivity to impulses.
